social_posts.post_text:
Also at @baselmiami this week I have a new small painting with @stephenfriedmangallery from my ‘Lisa’ series, which depicts my sister in law Lisa’s early days of motherhood. In this painting she’s seen with 2 day old baby Layla having just got home from hospital, with the gifts already beginning to pile up around her. 
On view at Booth F25.

Early Days, 2022, oil on board, 43 x 35 cm
Photo: @petermalletphotography 

@artbasel #artbaselmiami #stephenfriedmangallery #lisa #motherhood

I’ve had the pleasure of being on the judging panel again this year for the @safstudentprize  London, which is an art prize for pupils at London schools/sixth form colleges. These are a few pics of my stand out favourites- some incredibly skilful and thoughtful work, especially for such young artists. And my favourites also happen to all be work by girls! 🤩
The 21 finalists’ works are on show @phillipsauction in Berkeley Square until the 8th December. Well worth popping in for a look if you’re in central London. 

Images:
1. Fragments, Ivy Hartley-Drewe (aged 16)
2. Stream (detail), Amy Allen (aged 17)
3. The Threads Keeping Me Together (detail), Bunny Lawrence McHugh (aged 16)
4. Doll, Xi Yang (aged 16)

#safstudentsprize #sovereignartfoundation

Exciting to see this great feature on my work in @publicartmagazine in Korea! Article by @oksusu35 
Thanks so much to @janguklee.art for his role in introducing my work to them 💙💙

The article features work from my ‘Birth Reflections’, ‘Lisa’, ‘Janet’, ‘Nearby’ and ‘Bathhouse’ series, all photographed by the one and only @petermalletphotography and exhibited by @grimmgallery @stephenfriedmangallery @inglebygallery @fitzroviachapel and @spacek_korea 

 #publicart #magazine @publicartmagazine

Some available publications -
1.
A couple of new books from this year: ‘Birth Reflections’, published by the @fitzroviachapel to coincide with my exhibition there and @uclh with an introduction by Hannah Watson and an ‘in conversation’ between myself and Guy Noble (curator at UCLH) available to buy through @trolleybooks 

‘A Female Gaze’ published by @beameditions on the occasion of my joint solo show with Dame Laura Knight, curated by @trisaver @nottinghamcastle 
Includes an introduction by @trisaver and essay by @jennifer_higgie 

2 & 3-
‘Windows’ published by @grimmgallery on the occasion of my solo show @km21 in 2021 with an essay by @kunstmuseum.nl director Benno Tempel

‘Women’s Work’ published my @mac_birmingham to accompany my solo exhibition there in 2021. Introduction by @mac_birmingham director Deborah Kermode and essay by Griselda Pollock. 

‘Janet’, Co-published by @inglebygallery and @anomie_publishing in 2020 documenting my first exhibited body of paintings on the subject of my mum @inglebygallery . Essay and interview by @hettiejudah 

To find out where to buy any of these, follow the link on my bio to my website which has further info. 📚

Doing a shout out here for my friend and great painter @garethcadwallader who has made this beautifully intricate screen print to raise money for Kate’s Home Nursing, a palliative care charity who nursed his father when he was terminally ill earlier this year. 
This is a great opportunity to own one of Gareth’s works (otherwise very hard to get) and to support a cause close to his heart. And all for the very reasonable price of £60! 

More info here from Gareth himself-
Posted @withrepost • @garethcadwallader ‘Rood Screen’, 2022 
(Screen print on A3 paper, signed and numbered, edition of 45)

This is a screen print to raise money for Kate’s Home Nursing, a palliative care charity who nursed my father through terminal illness earlier this year. I don’t know how my family and I would have coped without their support, so this is a cause that's very close to my heart. Please consider buying one - they're only £60, including UK postage (£75 overseas). 

The print will only be available from now until Feb 10th because I would like to make a donation on his anniversary. 

To order, please email your NAME and ADDRESS (and how many prints you’d like) to: info@garethcadwallader.co.uk 
I’ll get back to you with payment details. 

(All orders before 20th Dec will be shipped on 21st, so you can get them for xmas!)

A massive, appreciative thank you to Mark at @k2screen for donating his time.

‘Rainbow Riches’, 2022, oil on linen, 200 x 150 cm
This painting is part of my show ‘Women Observed’ K11 Shanghai on show until 12th February. It’s part of a little series I’ve been working on, on and off, over the past year about the British seaside. I was quite excited about the challenge of painting l the different light sources and very complex colour palette of this amusement arcade scene, but it’s definitely been the hardest painting all year to get right! 
Thanks to my friend @patsymcarthur for being the model for this 💙💚💕
Photo: @petermalletphotography 

#womenobserved #k11shanghai #k11artfoundation #britishseaside @k11artfoundation @k11musea @grimmgallery
Last studio visitor of 2022 “sticking stuff” while I try to work on the prep for a new set of lithographs which will be published with @enitharmon.editions in spring 2023. 🔜

It’s the last few days to catch the British Art Show 9 @theboxplymouth as it ends this Sunday 8th January. Can’t quite believe this touring show is coming to an end as it’s been a fixture for a long time- I first met curators @hammad_nasar_8 and Irene Aristizabal in 2018 and then with delays because of the pandemic it was a long time in the making and then over a year of the exhibition itself as it toured from Aberdeen to Wolverhampton, Manchester and finally Plymouth. As a painter, who’s most often shown alongside other painters, I’ve really enjoyed seeing my work in a different context and feel proud my work was included in the line up alongside some really important artists. Thanks to Hammad and Irene, everyone at the exhibiting venues, and to @grimmgallery and @stephenfriedmangallery for all their help with logistics. 
#bas9 #theboxplymouth

I’ve got a new big Janet painting up @inglebygallery in Edinburgh alongside some gems from their other gallery artists, as part of TWENTY FIVE, a group show celebrating 25 years of the gallery. Each year is represented by an artist they had a show with in that year- I’m Ms 2020, which is when I had my exhibition ‘Janet’. I’m looking forward to my next solo show with the gallery in early 2023… but in the meantime I’ve got some other things happening (see last pic of me looking very pregnant) 👶🏻 🔜

Posted @withregram • @k11artfoundation 𝗕𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗪𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗻
Art critic Dr. Shen Qilan walks into contemporary artist Caroline Walker’s (@carolinewalkerartist) first solo exhibition in China, 𝘞𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘯 𝘖𝘣𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘦𝘥, and senses the gentle gaze uniquely from a woman to other women through Walker’s observant and heartwarming paintings.

Dr. Shen will speak with Walker about her inspiration, creative process and her interaction with women whom she came across in her daily life and eventually became the subjects of her works. Register now to join their online conversation, K11 MASTER CLASS, on 9 February through the link in the bio.

女性之間

藝術評論家沈奇嵐博士走
進當代藝術家卡羅琳・沃克在中國的首個個展「被看見的女性」，從細膩和暖心的畫作中，感受到女性凝視其他女性的溫柔。

沈博士即將與沃克對話，細談她的創作靈感和過程，並分享藝術家如何讓日常遇到的各種女性入畫，成為她作品的主人翁。現在就立即按Link in bio，登記參加這個即將於二月九日進行的K11 MASTER CLASS藝術對談！

____________________
K11 MASTER CLASS: Live in a Real Life — Women Observed｜藝術對談：「生活在真實之中 — 被看見的女性」
📅 9 February 2023
🕣 7:30pm (GMT+8; Hong Kong 香港)
💬 English 英語
📍 Zoom Webinar 線上研討會
🎟️ Free of charge 免費

Enrol Now 立即登記 👉 Link in bio

📍Shanghai 上海: 𝘞𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘯 𝘖𝘣𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘦𝘥「被看見的女性」
Exhibition opens now until 12 February 2023
展期即日起至2023年2月12日

#K11ArtFoundation #contemporaryart #publicart #publicartseries #inconversation #womenobserved #carolinewalker #k11masterclass

Tomorrow night (Hong Kong Time) or late morning GMT @k11artfoundation will broadcast a conversation between me and Dr Shen Qilan where we discuss some of the themes in my exhibition ‘Women Observed’ on at K11, Shanghai until this Sunday the 12th of February. Link in my bio to sign up. 

#k11artfoundation #k11shanghai #k11musea #womenobserved

It’s the last few days to catch my show ‘Women Observed’ at K11, Shanghai which ends this Sunday 12th February. The show includes lots of oil sketches from my own collection of work that I’ve kept, particularly of my Mum, the paintings of whom I always find it hard to part with. These are a few of these oil sketches which are in the show. 
@k11artfoundation #k11shanghai #womenobserved #janet

Today is International Day of Women and Girls in Science! 
In 2019 I had the fascinating opportunity to observe women scientists working in the Rawlins lab @gurdoninstitute @cambridgeuniversity where they were researching the development of human lungs. These are a few of the resulting paintings which are currently on show in Shanghai as part of my exhibition ‘Women Observed’ at K11 @k11artfoundation 
The last pic is of me and Daphne at @miniprofessorswestfife where we go every Saturday morning for a science class👩🏻‍🔬 🧪🧬🦠🌡️🧫🩻⚗️🔭

Photos of paintings: @petermalletphotography 

#internationaldayofwomenandgirlsinscience #gurdoninstitute #rawlinslab #miniprofessors #miniprofessorswestfife

Art and life entwined… this time last year I was midway through the short run of my exhibition ‘Birth Reflections’ @fitzroviachapel which took as it’s subject the EGA Maternity wing @uclh and the women that work there as midwives, nurses and doctors, as well as labouring and new mothers. Fast forward a year and I’m recovering at home with a new baby boy, Laurie, born last Thursday at the Victoria Hospital in Kirkcaldy. I’ve included a few shots here of the fantastically kind and caring midwives and nurses who looked after Laurie and me in his first day alive ,alongside images of the paintings I made of women showing the same care for new mothers down in London. 
Huge thanks to @nhsfife 💙💙
#nhsfife #fifematernity #uclhmaternity #fitzroviachapel #birthreflections

Back in the summer I had the pleasure of meeting this talented young artist, Chloe, who was a finalist in @cbbc ‘Britain’s Best Young Artist’. Chloe and I talked about different coloured grounds for painting on and discussed ideas for her final piece. The final is on tv tonight at 6pm and then on @bbc iPlayer. I’m looking forward to seeing what Chloe did for her final masterpiece and hoping she won the show! 
#britainsbestyoungartist #cbbc

I’m delighted that this painting of my mum is now in the collection @icamiami 🌟
Big thank you to @inglebygallery 

Posted @withregram • @icamiami #RecentAcquisition ✨ Caroline Walker is best known for capturing female subjects in tender, quiet moments of mundane labor.⁣
⁣
Walker (b.1982, Dunfermline, UK) paints from photographs she covertly takes herself, documenting the cultural, economic, and racial issues that face a diverse group of contemporary women. Her subjects vacuum, hang laundry, wash dishes, water plants, cook meals, and more.⁣ Viewers become voyeurs, spying on fragmented narratives of women, especially her mother, as seen in "Dusting Ornaments, Late Morning, March" (2021). 
⁣
"My parents took very traditional, gendered roles – my Dad went out to work and then spent the weekends doing building projects on the house, while my Mum took the role of the homemaker – cooking, cleaning and looking after me and my brother... I was both delighted to have my Mum at home all the time and quite adamant that that wasn't what I would do when I grew up. I think it was this early questioning about the roles of women and that conflict between career and home that sparked a fascination that's continued in my work as an artist." — @CarolineWalkerArtist⁣

———
(1–2) Caroline Walker, "Dusting Ornaments, Late Morning, March," (2021). Oil on linen. Linen: 70 7/8 x 82 5/8 in. Framed: 72 5/8 x 84 1/2 x 2 1/4 in. Museum purchase with funds provided by Aleksandra Janke & Andrew McCormack. Image courtesy the artist and Ingleby Gallery. Photo by Peter Mallet. (3) Artist portrait. Photograph by Peter Mallet.⁣
⁣
#ICAMiami #MiamiMuseum #MiamiArt #RecentAcquisition #CarolineWalker #Janet #DustingOrnaments #March #WomensHistoryMonth #OilonLinen #ContemporaryArt #ContemporaryArtist #InglebyGallery @InglebyGallery @PeterMalletPhotography

A detail of ‘Covering, Late Evening, June’ which is currently on display @inglebygallery as part of ‘TWENTY FIVE’, a group show celebrating 25 years of the gallery. The show is on until the 31st of March. 
Photo: John McKenzie

#inglebygallery #janet

‘Night Change’, 2022, oil on board, 36 x 30 cm
This little painting is currently on show at the @foundlingmuseum as part of their exhibition ‘Finding Family’ which runs until the 27th August. This little excerpt from the wall text next to the painting rings true as I write this during the nocturnal shift with my newest arrival..

“Reflecting on the intensity of early motherhood, the exhaustion, the loneliness, the comforting routine and mundanity of it all, Walker captures those elusive emotions and the ‘invisible hours’ of unseen and often undervalued labour undertaken by mothers, parents and caters, and the immense responsibility it carries.”

Photo: @petermalletphotography 
@stephenfriedmangallery 
#foundlingmuseum #lisa #findingfamily

This week at the @londonoriginalprintfair @enitharmon.editions will be presenting a new set of 4 lithographs titled ‘Nocturnes’ that I worked on over the autumn/winter. Here are some images of the process of making them, both in my studio and then @pauperspress where I worked with the fantastic Mike Taylor. The prints feature my mum, Janet, sister in law, Lisa and daughter, Daphne as the subjects. Here’s what I wrote about the set: 

‘Nocturnes brings together recent family subjects touching on themes of women’s domestic labour, with night scenes which have been a recurring motif in my work for over a decade. Depicting everyday activities, from my daughter watching tv before dinner, to my mum seen washing dishes or taking the bins out late on a midsummer’s night, to the darkened space of a bedroom, lit only by the streetlights outside the window, where my sister in law, Lisa, feeds her baby. 

The medium of lithography offers particularly rewarding results for building up the atmosphere and rich colour needed to depict these nocturnal scenes because of the complexity of colour that can be achieved through the layering of the different plates. I’m always taken by surprise by some of the colours that are created in the process, which is so different to the way I use oil paint. It’s both exciting and challenging working out how to build up an image in this way, with just 6 or 7 colours.’

The set is an edition of 35. Further details available from @enitharmon.editions 

#londonoriginalprintfair #nocturnes #enitharmoneditions #lithography

I’m very pleased to be on the selection panel of the shortlist for this competition for British painters. Looking forward to seeing the work in Huddersfield in September!

Some drawings for a new subject of women working on the hempcrete insulation being installed in our new house. I got very excited when I knew there would be women coming to work on site since they’re a rarity in the construction industry! Thanks to @hempcretecymru for being so accommodating to me hanging around with my camera. 👀
#hempcretecymru #womenatwork

‘Twilight’, lithograph, 53 x 43 cm, edition of 35

This is one of the 4 new lithographs in my set ‘Nocturnes’ recently published by @enitharmon.editions (link in bio)
This one shows my daughter, Daphne, watching TV early one evening last autumn. She’s told me she’d like this up in her bedroom! 

Here’s what I wrote about the set :

‘Nocturnes brings together recent family subjects touching on themes of women’s domestic labour, with night scenes which have been a recurring motif in my work for over a decade. Depicting everyday activities, from my daughter watching tv before dinner, to my mum seen washing dishes or taking the bins out late on a midsummer’s night, to the darkened space of a bedroom, lit only by the streetlights outside the window, where my sister in law, Lisa, feeds her baby. 

The medium of lithography offers particularly rewarding results for building up the atmosphere and rich colour needed to depict these nocturnal scenes because of the complexity of colour that can be achieved through the layering of the different plates. I’m always taken by surprise by some of the colours that are created in the process, which is so different to the way I use oil paint. It’s both exciting and challenging working out how to build up an image in this way, with just 6 or 7 colours.’

Another lithograph from the new set ‘Nocturnes’ published by @enitharmon.editions 
This one, ‘Early Evening’, depicts my mum, Janet, in the kitchen cleaning up. The view into a warm interior at night from the twilight lit outdoors is a recurring motif in my paintings so it was fun to tackle this in the more restricted palette of the lithographs where I was layering just 7 colours. This one was tricky working out how to create the spatial depth and the sense of inside/outside.

‘Late Evening’ 
Lithograph on paper
52 x 42 cm
Edition of 35
 
The third of my four new lithographs in the ‘Nocturnes’ set published by @enitharmon.editions 
This one depicts my mum taking the bins out late one evening last June. I loved the sky with the silhouetted trees that night, which made me think of Magritte.

Photo: @petermalletphotography

The last of the 4 lithographs in the new set ‘Nocturnes’ published by @enitharmon.editions 
‘Midnight’ shows my sister in law @lisaamin5 feeding my niece, Layla, late at night when she was just a few months old. I enjoyed working with a limited palette for this one to try capture the low, subdued lighting in the room. 
Photo: @petermalletphotography 
Link in bio to Enitharmon Editions for print sales.

I’m delighted that this painting is part of the @royalacademyarts Summer Exhibition this year! Big thanks to @david_remfry_ra and the committee for inviting me to show a work. This painting, titled ‘Birthing Ball’ is part of the series, Lisa, depicting my sister in law in the final days of pregnancy and early days of motherhood with her first child. I made the painting for my solo show @k11artfoundation in Shanghai last winter so I’m very pleased to have a chance to exhibit it in London, especially in a show seen by so many visitors.
I’m looking forward to seeing the exhibition myself when I’m in London later this month.

Photo: @petermalletphotography 
Thanks to @stephenfriedmangallery for helping organise 

#rasummerexhibition #royalacademyofarts #lisa #maternity

Some details of a new large painting which will be shown with @stephenfriedmangallery @artbasel next week. 
‘Sasha Batching Hempcrete’ is part of a new group of paintings depicting women from @hempcretecymru working on site mixing up and casting hempcrete at our home in Scotland. 
I’ve really enjoyed this different colour palette of muted tones. I got out my books on the 19th century ‘Glasgow Boys and Girls’ for inspiration on how to paint the rural setting. Some pics of those to follow. 

Photographs: Todd White Art Photography 
#artbasel #stephenfriedmangallery #hempcretecymru #womenatwork

‘Sasha, Batching Hempcrete’, 2023, oil on linen, 240 x 180 cm
On show this week with @stephenfriedmangallery @artbasel 

Framing by @frame_london 
Photo: Todd White Photography 
@hempcretecymru #hempcrete #womenatwork #womeninconstruction #stephenfriedmangallery #artbasel

My painting ‘Sasha, Batching Hempcrete’ on the wall on the @stephenfriedmangallery stand at @artbasel next to a lovely @sarah_ball_artist 

Photo: Mark Blower
#artbasel2023 #stephenfriedmangallery #hempcretecymru #womeninconstruction #womenatwork

Congratulations to @andrew.cranston on his beautiful show ‘Never a Joiner’which opened yesterday @inglebygallery 
Lots of big paintings full of painterly magic and narrative interest. Get yourself to Edinburgh and see them if you can! 🌟
#andrewcranston #inglebygallery

Some posts of a jam packed week in London. First up a visit to the @royalacademyarts Summer Exhibition to meet @david_remfry_ra and see my work ‘Birthing Ball’ on the wall. There’s so much to see in this joyful exhibition and David gave @afreemanbentley and I a great tour of some of the highlights, explaining how he and the selection committee managed to work out this complex puzzle of so many works to come up with a show that somehow makes sense!

Here’s a few pics I took but there were so many new discoveries I forgot to photograph. Definitely recommend going to visit. 
1. Me and David Remfry
2. Birthing Ball in situ 
3. @david_remfry_ra 
4. @barbarawalkerstudio 
5. @_nickgoss 
6. @lindseymendick 
7. @paularegostudio 
8. Richard Malone

#onlyconnect #rasummerexhibition #royalacademyofarts #davidremfry

Some details from the Berthe Morisot exhibition at the @dulwichgallery 
I enjoyed getting a chance to study Morisot’s feathery brushwork which becomes incredibly abstract up close. She was a master at creating spatial depth without the help of big tonal shifts- her subjects existing in a hazy world of muted tones. It would have been nice to see more of her paintings though as there was a lot of filler in the exhibition. 
#dulwichpicturegallery #berthemorisot

I went with my family to see ‘Night Change’, the painting of my sister in law, Lisa changing her baby’s nappy, in the exhibition ‘Finding Family’ @foundlingmuseum 
It’s a really nice exhibition with some interesting works on show, including historic paintings from their collection. 
#findingfamily #foundlingmuseum #lisa

I can’t recommend enough going to see @matthewkrishanu series of paintings ‘In Sickness and In Health’ which are on show @whitechapelgallery as part of the exhibition ‘Life is More Important than Art’. The subject of these paintings are Krishanu’s late wife, the writer Uschi Gatward, from her wedding day, to becoming a mother and then through her terminal illness. My husband, @elliot.payne.architect and I found standing in front of these subtle, sensitive paintings an emotional experience. They’re all the more powerful for being an understated and modest expression of love and grief. I can’t remember another time when I’ve been as moved by art. ❤️

This oil sketch is currently in the exhibition  PUBLIC PRIVATE @pondsocietyofficial alongside works by

An unexpected delivery last night of this lovely new children’s book ‘My Art Book of Adventure’ published by @phaidonpress which features my painting ‘Baby Layla’ as it’s first image. I’m thrilled to think lots of little kids will look at my painting of my sister in law Lisa and her baby- now 2 years old!

Opening this Thursday @telegraph.cz !
‘New Positions in British Painting’ Curated by @janemneal includes work by @justinmortimerartist @tomanholt @jessie_makinson @davidbriansmith1 and me. 
I’m very happy to be included alongside these painters and to be in a show curated by Jane again, as she’s been one of my longest standing supporters, first working with me in 2010. 
More images of the included paintings to come. 
#telegrapholomouc #britishpainting #robertruntakcollection @robert_runtak

Photo: @petermalletphotography 

#healthvisitor #womenatwork #telegrapholomouc #grimmgallery

This is the last week to catch the exhibition ‘Finding Family’ at the @foundlingmuseum in London (closes this Sunday, 27th August). The show includes this little painting of my sister in law Lisa changing her baby’s nappy late one night. I really enjoyed seeing one of my paintings of early motherhood in the context of this fascinating museum with its rich history as a foundling hospital.

#robertruntakcollection #telegrapholomouc #janeneal #britishpainting
Some snippets of work in progress in the studio 👀

This oil sketch ‘Sasha Mixing Plaster’ is part of the fundraising auction at @bonhams1793 for @_hospitalrooms ! The work in the auction will be on view at Bonhams on Bond Street in London from the 4th-12th September ahead of the auction on the evening of the 12th. More details online @bonhams1793 

Hospital Rooms is an arts and mental health charity that is radically transforming mental health hospitals. Since 2016, Hospital Rooms has created hundreds of art interventions in mental health hospitals across England, envisioning a world in which people in need of mental health care are immersed in vibrant environments, able to engage in collaborative artistic endeavours, and empowered to imagine fresh possibilities.

All proceeds from the auction will support Hospital Rooms projects in mental health hospitals, in particular a Children and Adolescent Service in Sandwell. 

This oil on paper study is part of a new series of paintings depicting women from @hempcretecymru working on our future home in Scotland. 

Photo: @petermalletphotography 
Framing: @frame_london 

#hospitalrooms #hempcretecymru

Happy 10th birthday to the fabulous @anomie_publishing 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
Founded by writer and curator @matthprice in 2013, Anomie have produced some really beautiful books over the past decade- many about painters I really admire. I was lucky to be the subject of their first book- ‘In Every Dream Home’ which was published to coincide with a solo show @pitzhanger which Matt Price also curated. I’ve enjoyed working with Anomie again in the years since, first with the release of ‘Picture Window’ in 2018 (Co-published with @grimmgallery ) and then ‘Janet’ in 2020 (Co-published with @inglebygallery )
And I’m excited to be a contributor to the upcoming monograph on the fantastic painter @jonathanwateridgestudio ‘Uncertain Swimmer’ which will be published later this month.

I’m delighted to be sharing a stage on Thursday 19th October with the acclaimed Danish novelist @olgaravn as part of ‘Barbican Encounters’ @barbicancentre We’ll be in conversation on the subject of motherhood, narrative, self-care and how this manifests in our respective creative practices. Link to tickets in my bio. 

Olga’s novel ‘My Work’, a brutally honest and at times funny account of pregnancy and early motherhood and all its accompanying anxieties, has just been published in English by @lollieditions . I highly recommend it. 🌟

‘Painting With Light’ curated by one of my favourite photographers @isabellelyoung (3rd image) opens this Thursday 14th September (6-8pm) at 79 Wardour Street (above Ann Summers as depicted in my 2017 painting ‘Late Opening’ - last image!)
In this exhibition Isabelle brings together painting and photography exploring the reciprocal relationship between the two. I’m delighted to be showing one of the ink drawings I made in response to spending time in the maternity wing at @uclh in 2021. 
All welcome to the PV on Thursday and the show runs until 1st October and online on @vortic.art until 4th December ✨

Over the last few months I’ve been busy painting nearly 200 porcelain discs to look like horn buttons! This fiddly but fun task has been in aid of a fundraiser for the fantastic @kettlesyard 
More info below on the project and the other artists involved-

• @kettlesyard We are delighted to announce our new project 'Artists Buttons.' 💥

Ten leading artists, Ai Weiwei, Jonathan Anderson, Rana Begum, Edmund de Waal, Antony Gormley, Callum Innes, Jennifer Lee, Cornelia Parker, Vicken Parsons & Caroline Walker, have been creating limited edition sets of buttons in support of Kettle's Yard. The buttons will be displayed at LOEWE's flagship London store from 11 - 15 October. 

⏳ Save the date: the buttons will be available to purchase from @kettlesyardshop online and in person from 11 October.

The project draws inspiration from potter Lucie Rie and our recent exhibition 'Lucie Rie: The Adventure of Pottery'. During the Second World War, Rie turned to button-making for a living, experimenting on a miniature scale with new forms and coloured glazes.

Similarly exploring different materials and techniques, each 'Artists Buttons' contributor is bringing their own approach to making buttons. 

All proceeds from the sale of 'Artists Buttons' will support the new Jim and Helen Ede Fund, a five-year initiative that aims to increase Kettle’s Yard’s endowment and enable further engagement with artists, local communities and young people.

Artists Buttons is curated by Andrew Nairne and Naomi Polonsky with production support from ceramicists Katharina Klug, Helen Johannessen, Lucy Dunce and David Stonehouse. The identity and packaging design has been supported by A Practice for Everyday Life.

Artists Buttons is supported by LOEWE. A Button Workshop accompanying ‘Lucie Rie: The Adventure of Pottery’ at Kettle’s Yard was supported by the LOEWE Foundation.

What a beautiful book about a seriously good painter @jonathanwateridgestudio ✨
‘Uncertain Swimmer’ published by the one and only @anomie_publishing with a major essay by the hugely respected art historian  @marcolivingstone and an in conversation between Jonathan and yours truly, where we get a chance to talk about all things painting and the incredible transformation in his work over the last 6 years. Wateridge has unbelievable facility as a painter but is also thoughtful, not afraid to shake up what he knows and take risks- I’ve got so much respect for him and am really made up to have been a little part of this book. 

Gorgeous book design by Joe Gilmore @eegijlmoor777 and produced by @hurtwoodbooks 
It’s officially out on October 12th in all good bookshops but you can grab an early copy this evening @hatchardspiccadilly where there will be a book launch 6-8pm 

Worth it for all these beautiful painting details alone!

Next Thursday 19th October I’ll be in conversation at the @barbicancentre with the brilliant novelist and poet @olgaravn discussing motherhood and narrative. Link to tickets in my bio! 

Posted @withregram • @barbicancentre Meet creative @carolinewalkerartist, this week’s #SundaySpotlight as she talks about what led her down the path of art 🎨

‘After my own experience of becoming a mother I felt that the reality of giving birth and the weeks after at home were not something I’d seen often in paintings. Especially the visual landscape of this, with its domestic clutter, and endless deliveries of gifts or equipment; seemingly essential to being a parent in the 21st century. 👶

I could see that it could make for a rich subject for painting with the opportunity to make visible this very intense period in one’s life, which once it's passed, can be difficult to recall with clarity.’ 🖌

Come along to her Encounters on Thu 19 Oct as she discusses motherhood, art, and self-care.

On view with @grimmgallery stand G6 this week @friezeofficial 
‘Feeding Rounds I’ , 2023, oil on board, 45 x 36 cm depicts our local sheep farmer bottle feeding baby lambs (including her son’s favourite ‘Splodge’!) 
Thank you to @craigduckieshepherdshuts for having us over to the farm during lambing season to see how it all works 🐑 and cuddle some baby lambs. 🤍
#womenatwork #lambingseason #grimmgallery #friezeartfair

Dylan was one of the team from @hempcretecymru who came up to Scotland last winter to cast hempcrete insulation on the walls of our future home. Thanks to @roserestorations for letting me hang around watching. 🌟

“She understood the child through the objects that belonged to the child’s world”
One of the many lines in @olgaravn novel ‘My Work’ which I found myself thinking/saying “yes!” to as I read. The objects of early motherhood were a big part of my paintings of Lisa because they form so much of the visual landscape of this time with a new baby. 
Currently on my way down to London for Olga and I’s in conversation event at the @barbicancentre tomorrow night (Thursday 19th). Tickets via link in bio

#barbicanencounters #lisa #motherhood @stephenfriedmangallery

I’ve curated a show! Thanks to @jorggrimm for the opportunity to invite some painters I admire to show in Grimm’s beautiful canal house gallery in Amsterdam. Pictured here is a gorgeous new painting by @afreemanbentley 

Posted @withregram • @grimmgallery Looking forward to 'The Painted Room', a group exhibition at GRIMM Amsterdam curated by Caroline Walker, opening Friday 3 November.
 
Bringing together artists from across Europe exoploring the interior through a spectrum of distinctive styles, 'The Painted Room' captures moments of dramatic tension in the domestic sphere, quiet scenes steeped in nostalgia, and gestural, impressionistic representations of life behind closed doors.
 
As an artist concerned with domestic spaces and the underrepresented labour of women in the workspace, Walker has assembled a group of artists whose work resonates with her own, including Gareth Cadwallader, Minyoung Choi, Andrew Cranston, Anna Freeman Bentley, Nick Goss, Hettie Inniss, Cece Philips, Elena Rivera-Montanes and Mike Silva.
 
A new publication will be published on the occasion of this exhibition, available in December 2023.
 
With special thanks to all participating artists and their representing galleries.

Opening tonight at @grimmgallery in Amsterdam! ‘The Painted Room’ is my first foray into curating and brings together painters working in the UK who explore the interior as subject. The exhibition includes this beautiful new painting by @hettie_inniss.art 🧡

#regram @grimmgallery 
Hettie Inniss is a recent graduate from the Painting MA course at the Royal College of Art, London. By working from her involuntary memories Inniss takes a Proustian approach to making, focusing on the unexpected moments where our senses are stimulated and the mind transports us to familiar or eerily unknown spaces. She uses her awareness of the constructability of memories as a tool to look beyond identity in a binary way.

This painting is included in the upcoming exhibition ‘The Painted Room’, curated by Caroline Walker. The exhibition brings together artists exploring the interior through a spectrum of distinctive styles, capturing moments of dramatic tension in the domestic sphere, quiet scenes steeped in nostalgia, and gestural, impressionistic representations of life behind closed doors. As an artist concerned with domestic spaces and the underrepresented labour of women in the workspace, Walker has assembled a group of artists whose work resonates with her own, creating a new dialogue on the role of the interior in contemporary painting.

Participating artists: Gareth Cadwallader, Minyoung Choi, Andrew Cranston, Anna Freeman Bentley, Nick Goss, Hettie Inniss, Cece Philips, Elena Rivera-Montanes and Mike Silva.

‘The Painted Room’ opens on Friday, 3 November, at GRIMM Amsterdam. Join us and the artists for opening drinks, 6-8pm!

Posted @withregram • @grimmgallery Nick Goss is an Anglo-Dutch artist who layers personal and collective history on the canvas through scenes of confident accretion and erasure, constructing and reconstructing phenomena that never had physical form. His paintings clearly summon the space of dreams, where time, space and identity slip, but the sense of a journey propels artist and viewer forward, a concept which is mirrored in his sound-based work sampling natural and interlinking ecosystems.

This painting is included in the upcoming exhibition ‘The Painted Room’, curated by Caroline Walker. The exhibition brings together artists exploring the interior through a spectrum of distinctive styles, capturing moments of dramatic tension in the domestic sphere, quiet scenes steeped in nostalgia, and gestural, impressionistic representations of life behind closed doors. As an artist concerned with domestic spaces and the underrepresented labour of women in the workspace, Walker has assembled a group of artists whose work resonates with her own, creating a new dialogue on the role of the interior in contemporary painting.

Participating artists: Gareth Cadwallader, Minyoung Choi, Andrew Cranston, Anna Freeman Bentley, Nick Goss, Hettie Inniss, Cece Philips, Elena Rivera-Montanes and Mike Silva.

‘The Painted Room’ opens tomorrow, 3 November, at GRIMM Amsterdam. Join us and the artists for opening drinks, 6-8pm!

Thank you Emily for this nice article about ‘The Painted Room’ @grimmgallery - link in my bio!
Posted @withregram • @emilycsteer 🕯️”The interior holds so much narrative possibility, and it can be a placeholder for an internal, psychological world.” I spoke to @carolinewalkerartist about the sumptuous group show she has curated at @grimmgallery in Amsterdam, which is all about interiors. The Painted Room sometimes takes the viewer into an empty domestic room, as though inhabiting it themselves; at other times they watch another figure lounging in bed, as if participating in a voyeuristic act. Read the full @wallpapermag piece at the link in my bio…

‘The Painted Room’ @grimmgallery in Amsterdam features 2 new paintings by the very talented @elenariveramontanes_art who I first discovered on Instagram when I was researching artists to include in the show. I love how these paintings sit in the space of the gallery next to windows, enhancing the play on inside/outside and the position of the viewer as seen in the work. Here’s a bit more info about Elena and the themes she explores : 

Primarily exploring themes of time, loss, and observations of life, Rivera-Montanes depicts interior and domestic spaces that are often familiar to her. Constructed through a nostalgic colour palette and photographic quality, she stitches together memories, overlooked moments and personal history to tell stories, prompting the viewer to perceive the paintings in relation to their own lives or experiences. Although many of the paintings are devoid of figures, the work in fact conveys friends and family who inhabited these spaces, remembered through belongings, objects and their sentimental value. Evoking a familiarity most can respond to, the work floats between the past and present. With reference to photographs she has taken herself, or found in her family album, Rivera-Montanes collages these liminal spaces to form fragmented moments in time, which explore the ambivalence between the places and people she can remember and what has been forgotten. Through the process of painting these moments, she aims to mirror how we recall, blur and rewrite our memories. 

The exhibition runs until 22nd December 

Photos: @jonathandewaart 
#elenariveramontanes #grimmgallery #thepaintedroom

These 4 oil sketches from 2017 are included in ‘New Positions in British Painting’ curated by @janemneal at @telegraph.cz in Olomouc, Czech which closes on 23rd November. Appropriately these oil sketches depict scenes from a series I made based on a photoshoot with models at a house in the Czech mountains. It was the first time I’d tried to paint snow- trickier than I had imagined! Really nice to see them brought together here as a group. 
#telegrapholomouc #janeneal @robert_runtak #robertruntakcollection

A few install shots of my work in ‘New Positions in British Painting’ curated by @janemneal at @telegraph.cz in Olomouc, Czech. The show closes in a couple of days time. Also in the show are @justinmortimerartist @jessie_makinson @davidbriansmith1 and @tomanholt 

Thanks to Jane for including my work and @robert_runtak 🌟

Opening tonight 6-8pm @stephenfriedmangallery in London is a big group show ‘ The Place I Am’ including all the gallery artists. My contribution is this small painting on board which is the beginning of a new series on nurseries and their predominately female workforce. This painting depicts a scene at @thegrovenurseryandpreschool in London which my daughter, Daphne, attended before our move to Scotland. I did the photography for these nearly 18 months ago so I’m excited to be starting working with the images in the studio now. 

Photo: @johnmckenziephotography 
#stephenfriedmangallery #womenswork #childcare #nurseries

My painting (on the right) sharing a wall with the fabulous @clarewoodsstudio in ‘The Place I Am’ @stephenfriedmangallery in London, on until December 22nd. 
Photo: Mark Blower

This ink drawing of me and Laurie when he was six weeks old has been printed in the New York Times @tmagazine to accompany a really interesting essay by @ligayamishan on artists and motherhood, and the not often discussed or celebrated choice of taking a step back from an artistic career to raise children. Link in bio to the article. 

Photo: @johnmckenziephotography 
Thanks to @firussellart and @grimmgallery

‘Study for Table Laying, Late Morning, May’, 2020, oil on paper, 46.5 x 62cm

This work is included in ‘Scottish Women Artists: 250 Years of Challenging Perception’ at @dovecotstudios in Edinburgh, on show until January 7th. The exhibition draws on the extensive @fleming_collection of Scottish art. 

I enjoyed visiting the show a couple of weeks ago, and seeing my work hanging next to a fantastic early @alison_watt_ painting. Also, I was very happy to discover a painting I haven’t seen before- ‘Nurse and Baby’ by Beatrice Huntington from 1915 (last couple of images here)

#flemingcollection #dovecotstudios #scottishwomenartists

The fantastic @minyoung._.choi is included in ‘The Painted Room’ @grimmgallery Amsterdam until 22nd December. I’ve known Minyoung’s work for nearly a decade and I love her imagination and sense of the uncanny with the otherworldly lighting and recurring characters or motifs, such as cats, fishtanks and the cute/slightly creepy one eyed cuddly stars! 
MinYoung’s also has an incredible looking solo show on @hivecontemporaryart in Beijing until next Saturday 16th December. 

Photos: @jonathandewaart

This oil sketch is at @artbasel Miami this week with @inglebygallery and is the first look at what my upcoming solo show (March 2024) with the gallery is all about. This is a study for a large painting of my daughter Daphne’s outdoor nursery and will be part of a group of works which focus on the women that are involved in my young children’s lives, influencing their development through care and education. From the women working at nursery, the swimming teacher, the teachers @miniprofessorswestfife and our health visitor to that ongoing favourite muse of mine, my mum, Janet, in her role as granny. Early years childcare and education is dominated by women, whether that’s in paid roles or as unpaid help from family, so it’s both an ideal subject for my work and a big part of my own life as I attempt to juggle the commitments of home and studio.

Photo @johnmckenziephotography

I’ve been a big fan of @mikesilvapainter work for a long time so I was delighted when he agreed to be part of ‘The Painted Room’, the show I curated @grimmgallery in Amsterdam. Mike gave us this beautiful painting of a not often seen subject for domestic interiors. I love how the drawn shower curtain leaves the suggestion there may be someone behind it. You can see the painting in situ until Friday 22nd December. 

Photo: @jonathandewaart

Very excited to announce this new publication made to celebrate ‘The Painted Room’ @grimmgallery which closes this Friday. Huge thanks to the gallery and in particular  @sebastiaanbrandsen for his, as always, considered and  beautiful book design. 

Posted @withregram • @grimmgallery We are pleased to present a new publication for ‘The Painted Room’, our current group exhibition at GRIMM Amsterdam, curated by Caroline Walker. It brings together a series of interviews with each of the artists selected to participate, alongside an overview by Walker herself. 

This is the final week to see ‘The Painted Room’, which brings together UK-based artists exploring the interior through a spectrum of distinctive styles, capturing moments of dramatic tension in the domestic sphere, quiet scenes steeped in nostalgia, and gestural, impressionistic representations of life behind closed doors. As an artist concerned with domestic spaces and the underrepresented labour of women in the workspace, Walker has assembled a group of artists whose work resonated with her own, creating a new dialogue on the role of the interior in contemporary painting.

As Walker notes, “The paintings in the exhibition explore the possibility of the interior; as a place of refuge from which to view the outside world, a personal space for memory and longing through the objects which inhabit it, or a site of constructed reality.”

The book is now available to buy through our online bookshop or at any of our international spaces. 

With special thanks to all participating artists and their representing galleries.
